Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glaze fired orange-brown; added white above added red band; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx seated to right (part of body and wing with red blob, part of chest in outline and upper part of right foreleg remaining); part of elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the sphinx, see British Museum 1888,0601.466.g. Lemos places the sherd in the Simple Animal Style, however, the proximity of the rosette to the sphinx is more consistent with the Mature Animal Style When elaborate rosettes appear on chalices with sphinxes, they usually appear on opposite ends. See Lemos no. 927 and no. 928 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 288, no. 859)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0671) (phase 2)
